intro: Achnatherum caragana, commonly known as the Chinese needlegrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family, Poaceae. It is a perennial species native to regions of Asia, including China, Mongolia, and Russia. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often on rocky or sandy soils. Its slender, wiry stems are covered with sharp, bristly hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The small, spike-like inflorescences produce wind-pollinated flowers, which are adapted to the dry, open habitats where the plant thrives.
